author: KAVYA CHRISTOPHER
title: Vinod Kambli’s Junglee avatar for Kannada film
text:
The pigeon translates to Junglee in Kannada and taking his Sandalwood debut with Bettanagere a step further, cricketer-turned-actor Vinod Kambli sports a tattoo of a pigeon right on his head through the film.
"We chose Vinod Kambli for this role as he has the right demeanour and look for it, though his personality is way different from what he portrays onscreen. He plays a rather smart and conniving character," says Akshaye Arjun, who plays one of the lead roles in the film. "For his first time in a language he is not familiar with, Vinod managed to essay the role with very basic prompting. He shot with us in Bengaluru. Since his wife was in town with him, he would head straight back to the hotel after the shoot," adds Akshaye.
Based on a real-life incident, the film captures the story of Seenu Bettanagere, who was murdered. The film has been directed by Seenu's own brother, Mohan Gowda Bettanagere. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
